original_title: Não Estávamos Ali para Fazer Amigos
overview: From the end of the Years of Lead, cultural movements that were previously stifled by censorship began to swarm across Brazil. Between the last dictatorial term and the Sarney government, musicians, actors, visual artists and all kinds of people emerged wanting to express themselves through art. Contradictorily, one of Sarney's first acts in power is to censor a work by filmmaker Jean-Luc Godard, a pioneer of the Nouvelle Vague.
title: Não Estávamos Ali para Fazer Amigos
